results.title: Total war: 1941-1945
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Hitler’s Germany”.
The most urgent problems facing Germany in the 1920’s and early 30’s were inflation, massive unemployment and political violence. This series examines Hitler’s solution to these problems and the rise and fall of the Third Reich as told by people who were there. Part 3 is set against the growing nightmare of mass bombing, invasion and finally defeat by the allied forces. The war against Russia brought no triumphs and in 1942 the war came to Germany with constant bombing raids ruining factories and placing heavy demands on medical and food services. We see the 1943 bombing of Hamburg, the retreat and submission of the German army and the final demands of Hitler, leading to 250,000 deaths in an attempt to defend Berlin.

results.title: Total fitness in 30 minutes a week
results.brief_description: A simple, thirty-minute-a week program for achieving physical fitness is outlined and demonstrated by Dr Laurence Morehouse and journalist Leonard Gross. The film is very specific in its training techniques for achieving total fitness. The teaching methods are direct and easy to follow

results.title: Tosca
results.creator_credit: Sylvano Bussotti, National Video Corporation, Radiotelevisione Italiana and Brian Large
results.brief_description: Giacomo Puccini’s opera in three acts with libretto by Giuseppe Giacosa and Luigi Illica is based on the original play written for Sarah Bernhardt by the French playwright Victorien Sardou. “Tosca” is a dramatic love story involving the ill-fated painter Mario Cavaradossi (Giacomo Aragall), his love, the singer Floria Tosca (Eva Marton) and the evil Chief of Police, Baron Scarpia (Ingvar Wixell) and set in Rome in 1800. Performed live at the magnificent amphitheatre of Arena di Verona, this made for television production features the Orchestra and Chorus of the Arena di Verona with conductor Daniel Oren and Chorus master Tullio Boni, along with grand scale set designs and period costumes by Fiorenzo Giorgi. Sung in Italian with no English subtitles. Includes booklet with English translation.

results.title: Tosca
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), John Copley and Peter Butler
results.brief_description: Recorded live at the Sydney Opera House in 1985 this lavish production of Puccini’s opera stars Eva Marton as Tosca, Lamberto Furlan as her lover Cavaradossi and John Shaw as the villainous Baron Scarpia. Puccini’s tale of jealousy, love and betrayal is set against a background of the Napoleonic wars, brought vividly to life by Allan Lee’s superlative sets and John Copley’s outstanding production. The Australian Opera and Chorus is conducted by Alberto Erede.

results.title: Torvill and Dean: path to perfection
results.brief_description: Chronicles the rise of world ice-skating champions Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean. Shows eight dance routines from the World Championships in 1980, 1982 and 1983, the European championships from Budapest and the Williams and Glynn Gala in 1982.

results.title: Torque about a crisis a torque special
results.brief_description: An ABC “Torque” special featuring Peter Wherrett in which he demonstrates that motorists can save on fuel consumption by adopting certain driver practices.

results.title: Toronto: boom town
results.creator_credit: Sydney Newman, Leslie McFarlane and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Canada carries on”
A contrast between the sedate Toronto, Canada, of half a century ago and the thriving, expanding metropolis of today

results.title: Toronto Symphony No. 2
results.creator_credit: Alan Field, ONF | NFB and Julian Roffman
results.brief_description: The third movement of Tchaikovsky’s Sixth Symphony in B minor, played by the Toronto Symphony Orchestra under the direction of its conductor Sir Ernest McMillan. The camera picks out different sections of the orchestra, and some well-known musicians.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alan Field, ONF | NFB and Julian Roffman

results.title: Toronto Symphony No. 1
results.creator_credit: Alan Field, ONF | NFB and Julian Roffman
results.brief_description: The Toronto Symphony Orchestra is shown playing three contemporary works: “Jamaican Rhumba” by the Australian, Arthur Benjamin; Sir Ernest MacMillan’s “A St. Malo”, a sketch for strings; and, finally, the Overture to the opera, “Colas Breugnon” by Dimitri Kabalevskv.
